content.prompt: What did SDS have most in common with the youth counterculture of the 1960s?

choices.label: A rejection of many of the values of their parentsâ€™ generation
A commitment to reforming society through direct political action
A desire to remove themselves from mainstream society and experiment with drugs
A determination to establish gender equality throughout the United States

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
